items.name: OP Autoclicker 2.1
items.description: No BS. Regular Auto Clicker, limited to 50 CPS
items.guide: Open App, select your Hotkey by pressing onto Hotkey setting, set your settings for the autoclicker, and press the Hotkey.

items.name: WindowsImageTool
items.description: Add NVMe or USB 3.0 Drivers to your Windows installation (example; Windows 7)
items.guide: Extract folder; open WindowsImageTool.exe, Make sure your Windows 7 USB Stick is plugged in, Select [None-Add USB drivers] in Source Path. Choose Windows 7 USB installation disk in Destination Path. Click [Start] to run and [Close] when the procedure is done.

items.name: Samsung 300K
items.description: Boot your Samsung device into Download-Mode incase it is stuck in a boot loop. (Old Version)
items.guide: Turn off device (unplug battery or fully drain battery), open the tool, connect to PC, then do instructions as told in Program.

items.name: Samsung 350K
items.description: Boot your Samsung device into Download-Mode incase it is stuck in a boot loop.
items.guide: Turn off device, plug in into PC, open program, Click button.

items.name: UnlockTool
items.description: (Version: 2024.12.22.0) FRP Unlock your device incase you forgot it! Snatched from unlocktool.net
items.guide: Guide by unlocktool.net (Slashes are inverted); Please uninstall Flexihub (EUsbHubFilter). Find name driver error (C:/Windows/System32/drivers - Delete or move onto your Desktop). Open Registry Editor - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SYSTEM/CurrentControlSet/Control/Class/{36fc9e60-c465-11cf-8056-444553540000} delete UpperFilters

items.name: Samsung USB Driver 1.7.61
items.description: The Driver necessary if you want to connect your Samsung Device to your PC.
items.guide: Just install. Installation may take long.

items.name: Samsung Odin v3.09
items.description: Flash your Samsung Device to fix any issues regarding the firmware, or modify it. [This version is meant for old Samsung Devices!]
items.guide: Import firmware by selecting them individually on the right side. Then just flash the device. If you want to use a Custom Recovery, please disable Auto-Reboot

items.name: Samsung Odin v3.13.1
items.description: Flash your Samsung Device to fix any issues regarding the firmware, or modify it.
items.guide: Import firmware by selecting them individually on the right side. Then just flash the device. If you want to use a Custom Recovery, please disable Auto-Reboot

items.name: Samsung Odin v3.13.3 [3B] Patched
items.description: Flash your Samsung Device to fix any issues regarding the firmware, or modify it. This is a patched version, more info here; https://xdaforums.com/t/patched-odin-3-13-1.3762572/
items.guide: Import firmware by selecting them individually on the right side. Then just flash the device. If you want to use a Custom Recovery, please disable Auto-Reboot

items.name: Samsung Odin v3.14.1
items.description: Flash your Samsung Device to fix any issues regarding the firmware, or modify it.
items.guide: Import firmware by selecting them individually on the right side. Then just flash the device. If you want to use a Custom Recovery, please disable Auto-Reboot

items.name: Frija v2.0.23364.3
items.description: Download Firmware to use on your Samsung Device. Official Github Page; https://github.com/SlackingVeteran/frija
items.guide: Enter information such as Serial Number/IMEI and Country code to download the latest official firmware that is supported to be flashed normaly.

items.name: Qualcomm Ports Driver + QDLoader 9008 HS USB Driver Setup
items.description: Driver required incase you want to connect your Qualcomm device in EDM with your PC.
items.guide: HS USB Driver has a regular setup. For the Ports driver, you need to open up Device Manager, right click the Qualcomm device, (Which may have a warning symbol on it or be named Unknown Device) press on update drivers, and then press Search on my device. Select the folder with the Qualcomm Ports Driver.)
